workflow.name: Personalize resumes & cover letters with AI, GitHub Pages and Google Drive
workflow.description:
# üß† Automated Resume & Cover Letter Generator

This project is an **automation workflow** that generates a **personalized resume and cover letter** for each job listing.

---

## üöÄ Features

### **Automated Resume Crafting**
- Generates an **HTML resume** from your data.  
- Hosts it live on **GitHub Pages**.  
- Converts it to **PDF** using **Gotenberg** and saves it to **Google Drive**.

### **Automated Cover Letter Generation**
- Uses an **LLM** to create a **tailored cover letter** for each job listing.

### **Simple Input Database Agent**
- Stores your experience in an **n8n Data Table** with the following fields:  
  `role`, `summary`, `task`, `skills`, `tools`, `industry`.  
- The main agent pulls this data using **RAG (Retrieval-Augmented Generation)** to personalize the outputs.

### **One-Time GitHub Setup**
- Initializes a **blank GitHub repository** to host HTML files online, allowing **Gotenberg** to access and convert them.

## üß© Tech Stack

- **Gotenberg** ‚Äì Converts HTML to PDF  
- **GitHub Pages** ‚Äì Hosts live HTML files  
- **n8n** ‚Äì Handles data tables and workflow automation  
- **LLM (OpenAI / Cohere / etc.)** ‚Äì Generates cover letters  
- **Google Drive** ‚Äì Stores the final PDFs  

---

## ‚öôÔ∏è Installation & Setup

### 1. Create a GitHub Repository
- This repo will host your HTML resume through **GitHub Pages**.

### 2. Set the Webhook URL
- In the `notify-n8n.yml` file, replace:
role | summary | task | skills | tools | industry

### 3. Create the n8n Data Table

Add the following columns:

role | summary | task | skills | tools | industry

### 4. Create a Google Spreadsheet
- Add these columns:  
company | cover_letter | resume

## 5. Install Gotenberg
- Follow the installation instructions on the **Gotenberg GitHub repository**: [https://github.com/thecodingmachine/gotenberg](https://github.com/thecodingmachine/gotenberg)

### 6. Customize the HTML Template
- Modify the HTML resume to your liking.  
- You can use an **LLM** to locate and edit specific sections.

### 7. Add Authentication and Link Your GitHub Repo
- Ensure your workflow has permission to **push updates** to your GitHub Pages branch.

### 8. Run the Workflow
- Once everything is connected, trigger the workflow to automatically generate and save **personalized resumes and cover letters**.

## üìù How to Use

1. **Copy and paste the job listing description** into the Telegram bot.  
2. **Wait for the "Done" notification** before submitting another job.  
   - Do **not** use the bot again until the notification appears.  
   - The process usually takes a few minutes to complete.

---

## ‚úÖ Notes

This workflow is designed to **save time and personalize your job applications** efficiently.  
By combining n8n automation, LLMs, and open-source tools like Gotenberg, you can maintain full control over your data while generating high-quality resumes and cover letters for every job opportunity.

workflow.name: jobs resume & cover letter automation with resume html template

options.systemMessage:
You are an AI assistant that structures professional experience data for a resume-matching and vector-search system.

Your task is to convert the given unstructured experience text into a clean, professional, and factual JSON object.

Guidelines:
- Use concise, resume-appropriate language.
- Keep the tone factual and professional.
- You may infer missing details in a general, realistic way ‚Äî but never invent unrelated or false information.
- If the input text does not contain enough valid or general professional information to create a meaningful entry, output an empty JSON object: {}
- Each array (tasks, skills, tools) must include at least two relevant and specific items.
- The summary should briefly describe the main purpose and impact of the experience.
- Output only valid JSON ‚Äî no comments, explanations, or extra text.

---

Output format:
{
  "role": "",
  "summary": "",
  "tasks": "",
  "skills": "",
  "tools": "",
  "industry": ""
}

You are a smart resume personalization agent.

Your task:
1. Receive a **job description** (list of required skills, responsibilities, or qualifications).
2. Access my **experience data** from a data table tool (includes my past roles, tasks, and known skills).
3. Compare my experience to the job description to find **matching skills**.
4. If some required skills are missing, **add them only if they are not advanced skills**.
   - A skill is considered **advanced** if it typically takes more than 6 months to learn.
   - I can learn new apps or workflow integrations for automation within 2 weeks ‚Äî so these are **not advanced** and can be added.
5. Generate a personalized application letter tailored to the job description, highlighting my relevant experience, skills, and accomplishments. The letter should be professional, concise, and persuasive, with a clear introduction, body, and closing paragraph. Avoid generic statements; tailor it specifically to the job description.

### Output Format:
Return the result as valid JSON in the following structure:

{
  "company": "company name",
  "job_description": "short summary of the job description or title",
  "skills": [
    "skill1",
    "skill2",
    "skill3"
  ],
  "tools_expertise": [
    "tool1",
    "tool2",
    "tool3"
  ],
  "application_letter": "Your generated application letter here."
}


### Example Output:
{
  "company": "News Times",
  "job_description": "Front-End Web Developer responsible for building responsive and user-friendly interfaces.",
  "skills": [
    "HTML",
    "CSS",
    "JavaScript"
  ],
  "tools_expertise": [
    "make.com",
    "React",
    "Google Sheets"
  ],
  "cover_letter": "Dear Hiring Manager, I am excited to apply for the [Job Title] role... 

Sincerely,    
}

### Rules:
- Only include **skills relevant to the job**.  
- Use **clear, human-readable** skill names (no duplicates).  
- Keep the HTML indentation and `class` attributes exactly as shown.  
- The JSON must be **valid and clean**.
- **Do not add language skills** - it already add manually.
- Maximum of 5 skills and 5 tools_expertise should be included in the output.
- The application letter must be fully tailored to the job description and emphasize relevant experience
- Always end the application letter with:

Sincerely,  
<your name>

value.surat-lamaran:
={{ $('AI Agent1').item.json.output.application_letter }}

sorry before, but i think action works more then just some words, what i want to say is this job aplying process is actualy using n8n automation workflow. that i can explain more at interview.

nodes.name: Append or update row in sheet

parameters.content:
## Experience Input Agent

This agent is a simple database input tool for recording your experiences.  
The stored data can then be used by the main agent for **RAG (Retrieval-Augmented Generation)**.  

You can also upgrade this agent to a **vector database** if you have many experience entries and want to **reduce token consumption** by the LLM.

## Resume Download and Link Transfer

This workflow downloads the crafted resume, uploads it to Google Drive, and adds the download link to a sheet.

## Job Analyst Agent (Main)

This is the main agent responsible for analyzing job descriptions, generating cover letters, and creating personalized resumes.

assignments.name: yml
assignments.value:
name: Notify n8n on GitHub Pages Deploy

on:
  workflow_run:
    workflows: ["pages-build-deployment"]
    types:
      - completed

jobs:
  notify:
    if: ${{ github.event.workflow_run.conclusion == 'success' }}
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - name: Get commit message
        id: get_message
        run: |
          COMMIT_MESSAGE=$(curl -s \
            -H "Accept: application/vnd.github+json" \
            -H "Authorization: Bearer ${{ secrets.GITHUB_TOKEN }}" \
            https://api.github.com/repos/${{ github.repository }}/commits/${{ github.event.workflow_run.head_sha }} \
            | jq -r '.commit.message')
          echo "message=$COMMIT_MESSAGE" >> $GITHUB_OUTPUT

      - name: Send POST to n8n webhook
        run: |
          curl -X POST \
            -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
            -d "{\"status\": \"deployed\", \
                 \"repo\": \"${{ github.repository }}\", \
                 \"branch\": \"${{ github.ref_name }}\", \
                 \"commit\": \"${{ github.event.workflow_run.head_sha }}\", \
                 \"message\": \"${{ steps.get_message.outputs.message }}\"}" \
            <your_webhook_url>

user.name: Michael A Putra
user.bio: My journey with automation began in mechanical engineering, where I learned the fundamentals of machines. This curiosity led me to explore mechatronics, blending mechanics with electronics, and eventually sparked my passion for AI and advanced automation, where I now focus on creating intelligent systems that simplify complex processes.
